page.title: 08MEDICAL SERVICE - LYME REGIS
page.content: Besides two opticians and four doctors, Lyme Regis has a 24-bed hospital dealing with medical, surgical transfer and outpatients, and also minor casualties. Urgent cases are taken to Exeter or Weymouth. 90% of the patients are over 70 and the hospital does not take young children. It contains a permanent physiotherapist and an X-ray unit used once weekly. There is a visiting dietician, chiropodist and speech therapist; surgical consultant, family planning and ear, nose and throat clinics (the latter beginning this August) are held twice monthly. The health visitor is based at the hospital and the district nurse takes messages from there.
